com.reactivecascade.i.reactive

Interface IAtomicValue<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Superinterfaces:
    IGettable<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PersistentValue, ReactiveInteger, ReactiveLong, ReactiveValue

    public interface IAtomicValue<T>
extends IGettable<T>
    The contract for a thread safe model object which may also contain additional reactive features.

    The default implementation ReactiveValue uses an AtomicReference internally.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • get

        T get()
        Get the current valueAR.

        The value returned may change at any time. Therefore if you need to use it several times, keep your algorithm internally consistent by keeping an unchanging copy in a local variable for the duration of the function. Your function should also re-start either directly or indirectly the next time the value changes.

        Specified by:
        get in interface IGettable<T>
        Returns:

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Implementations are required to map this value to be get().toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:

      • set

        boolean set(T value)
        Set the current value.

        In the case of ReactiveValue which also implements IReactiveSource, which will also trigger all down-chain IReactiveTargets to receive the update. Any associated chain will only fire if the value set is new, not a repeat of a previous value.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value asserted
        Returns:
        true if this is a change from the previous value

      • compareAndSet

        boolean compareAndSet(T expected,
                      T update)
        Replace the current valueAR with an update, but only if the valueAR is the expected valueAR.

        This is a high performance concurrent atomic compare-split-swap. For more information, see AtomicReference.compareAndSet(Object, Object)

        Parameters:
        expected - - Must be of the same type as update and must be the current value or the state will not change.
        update - - The asserted new value.
        Returns:
        true of the expected value was the current value and the change of state completed successfully
